intro: Horkelia arrhiza, commonly known as the threadleaf horkelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its slender, thread-like leaves. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Horkelia arrhiza typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in open habitats. It is often found in alpine or subalpine regions, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions.
